address: 79 Ho√†ng VƒÉn Th·ª•, KDC Ch√°nh Nghƒ©a,Th·ªã x√£ Th·ªß D·∫ßu M·ªôt, B√¨nh D∆∞∆°ng
comment:
Used to love this place, food was great and served quickly.
Now it takes twice the time and the food is only half as good.
It wasn't downright terrible, but nothing like the quality it used to be. 
Menu changed and is now very uninspiring. 
All soups had the same broth (we tried 3 different), presentation of the snapper with sweet and sour sauce was hideous, deep fried fish butchered and carelessly covered with sweet and sour glooop. 
The table next to us ordered mi xao bo and it looked no better than what you can get at any street vendor. 
Only one month between visits, was very surprised with the sharp decline in quality.
Don't know what happened, looks like some smart-ass excel guy came in and cut the kitchen size in half, fired the good chef and increased amount of seats.

We will not be returning again.

comment:
Photo in display differs in reality. No chocolate on top. 

I would like a cup of coffee. Got Vietnamese style drip but very small portion. No condensed milk. 

I cannot get a strong cup of coffee.  I was hoping to find an American breakfast. 

One adorable staff. 

I tried to order Arabica coffee, which is on display, but I get the impression that it's not sold here. 

I read the comments on the site about good conversation here, but I am single, and male. Polite, clean. Nobody speaks to me. 

I am thinking about trying another place next. Time is 816 am. 

Not impressed. Not repulsed. Not impressed.

comment:
Title says it all. Ordered a pizza Torino confirmed the order and the delivery driver was already waiting for the food. I was told their had been a last minute price change and i would need to pay extra. After telling the staff that i had no cash at home to pay the extra money they cancelled my order after waiting 45-minutes, big waste of time and money.

After having also eaten there in person I would say there are much better pizza places in town. The food is average at best and not worth the price!

address: 164 Ch√¢u Th·ªã Vƒ©nh T·∫ø,Qu·∫≠n Ng≈© H√†nh S∆°n, ƒê√† N·∫µng
comment:
We came in here on a date night and the service was one of the worst we have ever gotten. First when we came in they had us standing in the middle of the restaurant looking lost af while waiting for them to clear a table. Fine whatever. Then we were led upstairs to our table, where we were sat with 3 other tables (6 people). We ordered 2 dishes, steak and chicken, and had to wait for over 30 minutes with nothing but bread. The other 6 people keep getting their food but we got nothing in those 30 minutes. Not once did anyone came up to say anything about the long wait. Fed up and angry we came downstairs to leave, to be told that they're currently cooking it and we should wait a little more. No way Jose, I got places to go and people to meet. We made sure that there was nothing for us to pay and left the store. Not once did anyone say anything to us. 

Conclusion: waited 30+ minutes without food so we left. 

PS: It took 15 minutes to get our butter after asking for it to be eaten with bread. Unacceptable! 

I'm not going back and I don't recommend anyone visiting this place unless you want to waste your time and get treated like trash. Just a whole lot of NOPE!

comment: Terrible service and rude staff! We visited this restaurant this evening on our 2nd day in the city and were really disappointed. The waiter mixed up our order and charged us for 2 meat platters instead of one (bearing in mind there was only 2 of us there a I am vegetarian). The cashier then decided that 10 minutes into our meal we had to pay, which we would have happily done only to realise that we had been tricked into paying for 2 platters. Our waiter came over to apologise and said that he had miscommunicated the order but the manager (standing literally no more than 2 steps away) was going to charge us as she insisted on having seen my partner point at the picture in the camera (which is not true). My partner then had to explain his frustration to a teenage manager who didn't have the audacity to come over and talk to us herself meaning it completely ruined his meal and did not finish it at the end. Our waiter was so apologetic but when we did finally pay the manager gave us a rude comment and laughed after charging us incorrectly. Terrible really points you off Vietnamese hospitality if you are a tourist!

To whom concerning this complaint - starbucks Phan xich long

I had a bad experience at the 1st ground before getting in SB store with the parking service! The parking staffs told me to park at the hotpot store with the coca cola umbrella. I rode 2 times there and they did not let me parking! I came back and parked in front of the SB store! 
5:10pm i left the store, my motorbike tyre was flatted unconditional! I repaired the puncture at the motorbike repaired in front of Lotteria! Then on the way home, i had a punture! I have no word to comments on the bad attitudes of the parking staff! If my motorcycle had punture at night time without any repair store opened, or any accidents or injuries who will take this responsibility for those merciless acts! 
I feel very sorry to say that SB store needs to consider and take appropriate action, not only for myself raising this complaint but also for improving service! 
It is unacceptable in the world wide branch as Starbucks and service management! 
Look forward to your feedback!

comment:
Ti·∫øng Vi·ªát ph√≠a d∆∞·ªõi- Vietnamese caption below

We just got to Hue yesterday and decided to try "che" from this stall. Having read the review and articles online, we were certain that a cup of mixed che is only 10k VND or cheaper. However whenever we paid, it was 20k VND/cup, twice the actual amount. I came with a foreign friend and i myself have a northern accent (hue is central) and "che" 
from a stall next to Ngoc Hien was only 10k VND for a cup. If the owner wants to have good busnisses she shouldnt over charge customers so blatantly and while we were at the shop another foreigner was overcharged with the same price. I have read another review from a vietnamese and apparently this has been a reoccuring issue. This reflects the quality of "che" fromt this place itself and the owner's dignity. I'd reccommend finding somewhere else if you want reasonable price and higher quality service and food.

address: 43 Nguy·ªÖn Ph√∫c Chu, P. Minh An,Tp. H·ªôi An, Qu·∫£ng Nam
comment:
I need to start by explaining that the only other customers in the restaurant were a family of five who's food arrived shortly after we sat down. Was served 2 flat tiger's to start which we drank most of as we were so thirsty. 
This was followed by a 50 minute wait for the first dish. I heard the service bell go in the kitchen a good 15 minutes before it was served and wasn't surprised when it was put on the table stone cold. As the dish was bbq pork this was less than ideal. Then the server acted surprised when I asked about it. As this was being reheated my partner finally recieved her food. 
Asked for money off and explained thoroughly why we felt we had been short changed but they had no sympathy. Almost never complain when eating out and very good at looking on the bright side but this experience just left us feeling cheated.
If you are there just go somewhere else. Lots of other food places within meters.

address: 334 Tr·∫ßn Ph√∫, P. 5,Tp. V≈©ng T√†u, V≈©ng T√†u
comment:
Do not eat at this restaurant unless you can speak Vietnamese well. Don't trust the staff and check prices by writing them down first before you order.

Me and my boyfriend ate at this restaurant this evening (24/12/2014). We live and teach in Vietnam, we understand Vietnamese prices and know how to speak a good level of Vietnamese.

Our hotel recommended that we should eat at this restaurant and we had terrible service. The first member of staff took our order and we noticed that many items did not have a price. We pointed at a picture and asked 'how much?' and he told us 100,000 per kg. When our bill arrived we were actually charged 550,000 per kilogram. As we received our bill, all the staff were laughing at us and it was obvious we'd been tricked. I explained how the first member of staff said it would only be 100,000 vnd for the one item, not 550,000. We then had several members of staff gang up on us and demand we paid. As we left everyone was laughing at us and the initial staff member was slapped and shouted at for telling us 100,000.
